But suddenly, in confirmation to what Samus said, the AI opened the steel security doors that prevented Samus from entering the Main Control Room. Shortly after the steel security doors opened, Samus cautiously slithered into the Main Control Room, still on alert that she might be dealing with a rogue AI.

Unfortunately for Samus, her Paralyzer emergency pistol fell off her Zero Suit's right holster during her transformation into a Naga. So basically, if Samus is actually going up a rogue Chozo AI, she is basically unarmed.

But as her serpentine-like eyes slowly scanned the large room, Samus noticed how advanced the equipment was within the research facility, as there were various keyboards and holographic monitors that contained different readouts of various upgrades. "Wow. Even after all this time, the Chozo's technology in this lab still works." Samus said in pure curiosity, still couldn't believe that even after the Chozo became extinct, the AI that they created still functioned like it was made yesterday.
1543111.title: An Unexpected Homecoming

15431111.content:
"AI?" Samus asked as she looked around. "Are you still there?"

"Yes, Samus Aran," the AI said. "Do you have an inquiry?"

Samus spotted a surveillance camera located above the main terminal. That was probably what the AI was using to monitor her with.

"How do you know my name?" Samus asked, looking directly at the camera.

"You were brought to this facility shortly after the Space Pirates attacked K-2L, the human colony world where you were born," said the AI. "The Chozo brought you here for medical examination, before proceeding to Zebes."

Samus nodded. While she remembered Ridley's attack on her colony and the death of her parents in vivid detail, most of her other memories from that time were foggy at best.

"Do you have a name?" Samus asked.

"I am the Chozo Artificial Intelligence Network," said the AI. "I do not have a name."

"Well, I'm not using that mouthful every time I want your attention," said Samus, pausing briefly to think of a name. "How about Cain?"

"An acronym formed from Chozo Artificial Intelligence Network," said the AI. "That is an acceptable designation. I am Cain, the artificial intelligence installed in this facility."

"Okay, Cain," said Samus. "What can you tell me about the Naga upgrade?"

"The Naga upgrade is designed to be compatible with the Zero Suit," said Cain. "This upgrade is based on the Naga deities from the Hindu and Buddhist religions on Earth, where they were depicted with humanoid upper bodies and snakelike lower bodies. Other relevant information will be displayed on the main terminal."

The terminal in front of Samus lit up as words filled the screen.

"I see it," said Samus. "Thanks, Cain."

"You are welcome, Samus Aran," said Cain.

Samus turned her attention to the screen in front of her and began reading. The first section didn't contain much she was interested in, mostly just detailing the inspiration and creative process of the Naga upgrade. The second section had a list of all the changes that had been made to her body by the upgrade, which was far more interesting.

The Naga upgrade's serpentine body is approximately 11 feet long (3.36 metres). As a result, Samus Aran's total length is 14 feet (4.27 metres), measuring from the top of her skull to the tip of her tail. The resultant new musculature adds approximately 250 pounds (113.4 kilograms) of mass. As a result, Samus Aran's total mass is 450 pounds (204.12 kilograms). The new musculature includes enhancements to Samus Aran's existing upper body, increasing the amount of mass Samus Aran can lift from approximately 600 pounds (272.15 kilograms) to 1 ton (2000 pounds, 907.18 kilograms). The serpentine body can also increase Samus Aran's top movement speed from approximately 40 miles per hour (64.37 kilometres per hour) to approximately 60 miles per hour (96.56 kilometres per hour).

The Naga upgrade also affects Samus Aran's visual and olfactory senses. Samus Aran's eyes can now detect infrared light, allowing limited heat vision. However, in order to compensate, Samus Aran's eyes are now less capable of distinguishing between colours in the violet end of the visible light spectrum, and she will have difficulty telling the different between black and darker shades of blue. Samus Aran will also develop a forked tongue, which will periodically exit her mouth through a small divot in her upper lip. This forked tongue will collect airborne particles, which will be drawn into her mouth and analysed by a vomeronasal organ (Jacobson's organ), which will allow her to analyse tastes and smells, and can also be used directionally to a small degree. However, Samus Aran's nose will be less able to detect scents due to the changes made to her nasal structure to accommodate the vomeronasal organ.

As humans are homeothermic, Samus Aran will be able to maintain a stable body temperature in most climates. However, due to her new ectothermic nature, Samus Aran will be adversely affected by low temperatures, which will cause her to become sluggish. At temperatures at or below 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius) Samus Aran's body will no longer be able to maintain a stable body temperature, and she will freeze to death.

Samus read through the information on the monitor carefully, taking note of the drawbacks to her new body that she hadn't noticed before. She also spotted a list of upgrades that were compatible with the Naga upgrade, though none of them seemed too interesting at the moment. A prompt at the bottom of the screen asked if she wished to download the information for future reference, and Samus accepted. The terminal saved the data and sent the file to her Power Suit, which was still where she had left it, back in the main research hall. When Samus realised that her Power Suit was back in the research hall, she remembered that she had wandered down here to ask the AI if it was possible to modify the Naga upgrade so that her new scales were a different colour. However, after reading through the information regarding the Naga upgrade, she was also wondering if she could combine the Naga upgrade with a second upgrade.

"Cain?" Samus said. "I have a question."

"How can I help?" the AI asked.

What did Samus ask?

With the biometric scan said and done, Samus instinctively cracked her knuckles some as she said, "...Alright, let's get to work." From there, Samus began to gently slide the multi-colored bars from left to right to see which colors she personally preferred for her Naga scales. Eventually, after what seemed like an hour of sifting through various colors that weren't purple-related, Samus had finally decided on a specific set of colors that she liked the best for her serpentine lower half, which was represented in the form of...

1543111111.content:
After sifting through various different color palettes, Samus eventually had decided to go with a Jade Green scale color, complete with yellow tiger stripes adorned throughout the length of her serpentine lower half. Suffice to say, she certainly seemed interested in this specific color scheme, as Samus calmly pressed a few buttons on the Chozo holographic keyboard in sequence, ultimately confirming her decision on the DNA Synchronizer machine.

From there, the machine whirred to life once more, as it then unclasped a medical gurney, which seemed to be large enough for someone of Samus's current size and serpentine physique, where Samus exhaled a deep sigh and said, "...Well, here goes nothing, Samus." After that, she proceeded to slither toward the sloped medical gurney, carefully positioning herself onto the gurney's metallic surface.

C.A.I.N bluntly replied, where it then autonomously activated the DNA Synchronizer's programming, causing six mechanical arms equipped with syringes full of genetic fluid to whir to life.

From there, she soon felt the liquid inside the syringes entering her bloodstream, gently and deliberately altering her serpentine lower half, as Samus soon heard light crackling noises coming from her scales. Looking downward toward her lower half, Samus could easily see that the fluid was certainly doing it's job, as the yellow and blue scales on her snake half rapidly changed colors, transitioning into a Jade Green hue with yellow tiger stripes adorned throughout her serpentine lower half. Finally, after a few minutes have passed by, the mechanical syringe arms slowly pulled away from the Naga bounty hunter, indicating that they were finished with the procedure.

"Genetic Sequencing: Complete. Warning: I would advise extreme caution before standing up, Samus Aran." C.A.I.N flatly answered, advising Samus on not taking any sudden movements until she has fully recovered from the medical procedure. Of course, Samus felt sore as hell from the procedure, experiencing some difficulty standing upright on her serpentine tail whilst the fluid began to dissolve in her bloodstream and her muscles healing from being injected in various different areas on her serpentine half.

Eventually after a few minutes have passed, Samus soon felt reinvigorated from the procedure, where she then slithered toward a nearby mirror typing o get a better look at her new scales, striking a few poses at her reflection in the process. "Hmph! Well, this had definitely proved to be most fruitful. Thanks, C.A.I.N!" Samus confidently replied, as C.A.I.N swiftly answered, "It is in my programming to serve, Samus Aran."

From there, Samus began to contemplate on what to do next. She had a few choice ideas to choose from. The first idea that came to Samus's mind was to renovate and refurbish her signature ship to better accommodate for her genetically altered physique. After all, her ship didn't exactly seemed to be Naga-friendly when it came to it's design and interior. However, the next idea was to alter and refurbish her Varia Suit to accommodate for her newly acquired Naga physique. And finally, there was the temptation of seeing what other Upgrades she could use while in the research facility. In the end though, Samus eventually decided to go with...

15431111112.content:
“C.A.I.N?” Samus asked. “Are there facilities to modify my Varia Suit?”

“Affirmative, Samus Aran,” C.A.I.N said. “The Varia and Zero Suit Modification Bay is located within this facility. I will mark the way for you. Would you like me to use visible lights, or infrared lights?”

“I want to try out my new eyes,” said Samus. “Give me the infrared lights.”

“As you wish, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. A door hissed open behind her, and Samus looked over her shoulder at the door. Above the door, she saw what appeared to be a glowing pink light above the door. Samus turned, and slithered out the door, and saw more pink lights along the left wall. She followed the pink lights, turning around a few corners to follow them. After a few minutes of slithering, Samus arrived at a different room, and found an array of machines waiting for her, with what looked like her Varia Suit, standing at attention in the centre of the room, being scanned by a mechanical arm.

“Is that my suit?” Samus asked.

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “I took the liberty of retrieving your Varia Suit from the Upgrade Hall and bringing it here. I hope you do not mind.”

“No, I don’t mind,” said Samus. “I just wasn’t expecting it, that’s all. Now, can you use this to modify my Varia Suit to fit my new body?”

“Affirmative,” C.A.I.N said. “Would you like to modify your Zero Suit as well?”

“Yeah, sure,” said Samus.

“Warning!” said C.A.I.N. “By removing the Zero Suit for modification without removing the Naga Upgrade, the Naga Upgrade must be permanently installed.”

Samus gasped, as she realised what she was doing. She had become so enamoured with her new body that she had completely forgotten that it was, in reality, simply a power-up that had been installed into her Zero Suit. Samus picked at the blue fabric that covered her human upper body. She hadn’t noticed it before, but her Zero Suit had been altered slightly by the Naga Upgrade as well. Her suit ended just before her scales in a belt, and the belt’s buckle was her Zero Suit’s upgrade slot. Her fingers traced the upgrade slot, and the Naga Upgrade held within. Was she really willing to become a Naga permanently? Maybe, now that she had changed her scale’s colours to her liking, it would be a good idea to remove the Naga Upgrade from her Zero Suit and return to her original human form.

154311111121.content:
Samus wasn’t exactly a stranger to genetic modification. After all, the Chozo had modified her DNA so she could survive on Zebes and use the Varia Suit without hurting herself. Even so, that had still left her (mostly) human. She loved her new form, it was true, and while it was certainly useful, Samus wasn’t willing to become a Naga permanently.

She grabbed the Naga Upgrade chip and pulled it out of her Zero Suit’s upgrade slot. Samus’ tail felt strange, and she looked behind herself to see the jade green snake body shrinking behind her. Her tail continued shrinking until it reached the size her legs had been before the transformation. She then felt a pulling sensation on either side of her tail as her tail split into a pair of legs. The green scales retreated up her tail as her legs formed, and once her legs had finished reforming, the blue fabric of the Zero Suit slid down and covered her up. She felt her fangs slide up back into her mouth as they turned back into regular teeth, and her tongue stopped darting in and out of her mouth as it became a regular human tongue again.

Once she was back to normal, Samus took a step towards the Varia Suit. However, she’d gotten so used to having a snake tail that she tripped over her own foot. Samus yelped in surprise as she tripped and fell on her face.

“Are you alright, Samus Aran?” C.A.I.N asked.

“Yeah, I’m fine,” said Samus, her words sounding a little slurred. “Just getting used to having legs again.”

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “Do you wish to cancel the Varia Suit modification?”

“Actually, I was wondering,” Samus said as she stood up. “Could you make a second Varia Suit for me? One that I could use while in my Naga form?”

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “Be advised, Varia Suit construction for your Naga form will take at least one hour.”

“Okay,” said Samus, nodding. “Do you need me to go use the Naga upgrade while you’re making the new suit?”

“Negative,” C.A.I.N said. “The biometric scan I performed earlier will suffice. Please return to the Varia and Zero Suit Modification Bay in one hour to receive your new Varia Suit.”

Samus nodded. She had an hour to kill before she got her new suit. When her new suit was finished, she’d put the Naga Upgrade back into her Zero Suit and try out the Naga Varia Suit.

What does Samus do in the meantime?

Once she reached the Main Control Room, she paused. She could remember the way back to the Upgrade Hall, and figured she could travel down there and try out some new upgrades, and possibly find upgrades that were compatible with the Naga Upgrade. Or, she could try and find some sort of gymnasium or training area that she could use to test out her Naga form.

On one hand, there were much more pros than cons when it came to her newfound serpentine form, including seeing things in infrared, as well as enhanced speed and strength. But on the other hand however, C.A.I.N did say that if she didn't uninstall the Upgrade Chip from the Upgrade slot before removing her Zero Suit, there was an extremely high probability that she would be permanently a Naga for the rest of her life. Needless to say, this was undoubtedly a life-changing decision for her.

Eventually, after weighing her available options, Samus uncharacteristically threw caution to the wind and decided to permanently install the Naga Upgrade, where she then calmly spoke toward the Chozo A.I and firmly said, "C.A.I.N, I need you to permanently install the Naga Upgrade." "Are you absolutely sure you want to proceed with this decision, Samus Aran? There is a potential 4.57 percent chance of possible negative side effects during the genetic infusion and solidification." "Yes, that's my final answer, C.A.I.N." Samus flatly answered, confirming what she wanted to the Chozo A.I, where C.A.I.N easily complied as it replied, "...Understood, Samus Aran. Commencing permanent DNA Splicing and Infusion... Warning: The process itself might be...painful." Moments later, as C.A.I.N began the permanent transformation, Samus soon felt a noticeably sharp jolt of pain throughout her spinal column and serpentine lower half, causing her to relatively collapse onto the metallic floor in pain. Fortunately for her, the process itself was relatively brief, as only a few measly seconds had passed before the pain swiftly subsided, allowing Samus to collect herself from the floor, just as she then heard C.A.I.N speak as it said, "DNA Infusion Sequence: Complete."

Shortly after that, Samus managed to stand upright with her long serpentine tail, shrugging off the residue pain somewhat, as she thought aloud to herself and said, "*sigh*...Well, that could've been much worse." "Do you still want to continue with the Varia and Zero Suit modifications?" C.A.I.N queried, wanting to know if Samus was still able and wanting to proceed with the modifications to both her Zero Suit and Varia Suit, just as Samus calmly discarded the scorched Naga Upgrade Chip from the upgrade slot, then spoke toward C.A.I.N and replied, "Affirmative, C.A.I.N. Just merely recovering from a little bit of whiplash, nothing more."

From there, after Samus had gave it the all-clear, C.A.I.N began to work on heavily modifying both Suits, starting off with...

1543111111221.content:
“Can you start with the Zero Suit?” Samus asked. “I think it was damaged when the Naga Upgrade was permanently installed.”

“That is correct, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. “Your Zero Suit formed the scales of your serpentine lower half, but the DNA Infusion Sequence made these scales a natural part of your body. As a result of the DNA Infusion Sequence, the lower half of the Zero Suit was destroyed, which also damaged the Naga Upgrade Chip.”

“I see,” said Samus.

“Would you like me to repair your current Zero Suit, or would you prefer a new Zero Suit?” C.A.I.N asked.

“I’d rather you repair the one I already have, thanks,” said Samus.

“As you wish, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. “Please remove your Zero Suit so I may begin repairs.”

“Sure,” said Samus. She reached down to her hips and grabbed the torn hem of her Zero Suit. She easily pulled it up over her head, then pulled her arms out of the sleeves. A mechanical arm extended from the ceiling, and Samus, now naked, held her Zero Suit out towards the mechanical arm. The mechanical arm accepted the Zero Suit, and C.A.I.N used the mechanical arm to place the Zero Suit onto a table that had risen out of the floor. C.A.I.N laid the Zero Suit flat on the table, and after a brief scan of the Zero Suit, several mechanical arms extended from beneath the table and began repairing the Zero Suit.

While C.A.I.N was altering the Zero Suit, Samus decided to get a better look at her new Naga physique now that she was naked. Her tongue flicked in and out of her mouth lazily as she looked herself over. She found that her jade green scales, which had previously stopped at her hips, now continued up her hips and ended at her waist, leaving her belly and breasts uncovered. She ran a hand over her rear, but found no sign of her butt. Looking down at where her crotch used to be, she could see that she still had a vagina.

“C.A.I.N?” Samus asked.

“Yes, Samus Aran?” said the AI.

“Were there any other changes made to my body when you permanently installed the Naga Upgrade?” asked Samus.

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “You now have a cloaca, rather than a vagina. Your cloaca is used for sexual reproduction and waste excretion. Additionally, you will now lay eggs, rather than give birth to live young.”

“Okay,” said Samus slowly. “And why were these changes made?”

“These changes were made to maintain biological functionality, and were created during the early stages of the development of the Naga Upgrade,” said C.A.I.N. “As the Naga Upgrade was never intended to be permanently installed, these changes were not implemented in the final design. However, when you expressed your desire for permanent installation, I implemented these changes during the DNA Infusion Sequence.”

“I see,” said Samus. “So am I more reptilian, or am I still a mammal?”

“Due to having both mammalian and reptilian traits, you would be classified as a reptomammal,” said C.A.I.N. “You are also the first and only member of the Naga species, unless you choose to reproduce.”

“So, if I had any children, would they be Nagas as well?” Samus asked.

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “During the DNA Infusion Sequence, I forced your genome to become dominant, meaning your offspring will always be female Nagas. However, if you wish to lay fertile eggs, you will need to mate with a male human first.”

“I understand,” said Samus. “Thanks, C.A.I.N.”

“You are welcome, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. “Zero Suit modifications are complete. Beginning Varia Suit modifications.”

Samus nodded, and slithered over to the table where her modified Zero Suit was. She picked it up, and noticed that the changes were minor, relatively speaking. The Zero Suit’s colour was unchanged, and there was still a belt at her hips, which contained the Upgrade Slot. However, the Zero Suit continued down as a single sleeve to about where her knees would’ve been if she was still human. She pulled the Zero Suit on over her head, and pushed her arms into the sleeves. Once she was dressed, she turned to see that C.A.I.N had removed the legs of her Varia Suit and was manufacturing armour plating for her serpentine body and tail.

“Varia Suit modifications will be complete in approximately thirty minutes,” said C.A.I.N.

Samus nodded. She was quite comfortable with her Naga physique, so she didn’t see any need to explore her new body further. On the other hand, her ship had not been designed with her current body in mind, so she’d need to renovate the interior. She was also curious about the other upgrades that were available in the Hall of Upgrades. There were presumably some upgrades compatible with the Naga Upgrade, as well as some that could be modified to work with her new form...
1543111111221.title: The Zero Suit, then the Varia Suit.

15431111112211.content:
“Are there any upgrades that are compatible with the Naga Upgrade?” Samus asked.

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “However, these upgrades were designed with your human genetic material as a base. These upgrades will require reformatting, to be compatible with your new Naga genetic material.”

“I see,” said Samus, her forked tongue darting in and out of her mouth. “How long will this reformatting take?”

“The reformatting process has already begun,” said C.A.I.N. “By the time you return to the Hall of Upgrades, the reformatting process will be complete.”

“Oh, okay,” said Samus. “I’ll head there now, then.”

“I shall mark the way for you, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N.

Samus slithered her way through the space station, following the trail of light pink infrared lights through the corridors. After about ten minutes of slithering, Samus reached the Hall of Upgrades. As she entered, she made her way over to the terminal. On the terminal’s screen, Samus saw two lists of upgrades.

“C.A.I.N?” Samus asked. “Are you still there?”

“Yes, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. “I am present throughout the space station.”

“Okay, so what am I looking at here?” Samus asked. “There are two lists here.”

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “The list on the left includes upgrades that are compatible with your Naga form. The list on the right includes upgrades that are incompatible with your Naga form.”

“I see,” said Samus. “There are a lot of incompatible upgrades.”

“Affirmative,” said C.A.I.N. “Those are upgrades that require a humanoid form. If you wish to use these upgrades, I have created a new upgrade that will allow you to return to your previous human form.”

“So... you’ve created a Human Upgrade?” Samus asked.

“That is correct, Samus Aran,” said C.A.I.N. “After using the Human Upgrade, you will be able to combine a second upgrade with the Human Upgrade.”

Samus nodded, and turned her attention back to the lists on the terminal. The list on the left was much shorter, and Samus could only see six upgrades that would work with her new Naga form. The rest were incompatible, but Samus could use the new Human Upgrade first, then use a second upgrade with the Human Upgrade.

What did Samus decide?

15532121.content:
Before the warning text even finished appearing on screen, Samus smashed the confirm button, hairline cracks appearing on the device around the tip of her powerful finger. A mechanical limb immediately emerged from the device, implanting a chip into her Zero Suit. "This is going to be great. I'll be even stronger!" she gloated in a voice that was already growing slightly deeper as the changes gradually took hold.

Like the Amazon upgrade, Samus' muscles were growing larger and more powerful, but at the same time, were losing their cut, toned shape, becoming bulkier and less defined. Even her impressive abs were hidden behind a round but firm belly that formed around her midsection. Despite her rapidly increasing strength, Samus was starting to feel burdened and sluggish, as if the weight of her own muscles was slowing her down, leaving her clumsy and graceless.

But her body wasn't the only thing becoming slower. Her mind began to change as well, becoming not only more aggressive but less intelligent, as not only information but capacity for reason and thought fled her mind. Samus groaned as her head began to hurt, her skull compressing in a few key spots, causing enough brain damage to leave her a simple minded specimen with no hope of regaining her former intellect. The upgrade also took the liberty of making the suit completely incompatible with any weapon more sophisticated than a club, its owner no longer intelligent or dexterous enough to operate advanced energy weaponry. As a final touch, the upgrade ramped up her libido to a ridiculous extent, making it difficult for her to focus on anything except her desires for sex and violence. "I have to stop this...I...me...need a gud fuckin'," Samus spat out in what was now a very deep, inarticulate voice.

The growth seemed to stop as Samus approached becoming twice as muscular as the Amazon upgrade had made her, but the changes in her body didn't stop there. She shot up another three feet in height, but instinctively adopted a sloppy, hunched over posture that brought her back down to about nine feet. Her shoulders grew wider, quickly becoming the defining feature of her already very broad frame, while her breasts vanished, her chest now dominated by bulging pecs. Her hands and feet swelled out of proportion as well, becoming huge and clumsy, her balled fists looking like wrecking balls. Her brow ridge lowered dramatically as her eyes dimmed and her nose and ears began to swell, giving her a brutish, animalistic appearance. Samus' skin became rougher, marked with countless scars, and her hair fell out of its ponytail, becoming messy and greasy, then shortening up to a very roughly cut chin length style.

The final changes hit the Zero Suit itself, causing it to lose most of its fabric, shortening into what resembled a wife beater and shorts combo. The new style fully exposed her monstrously large limbs, which were now coated in thick body hair along with Samus' armpits. It was clear now why this upgrade wasn't considered part of the Amazon series, having turned its user into more of a monster than a muscular beauty.

The newly "upgraded" brute snorted, discarded her now useless paralyzer, and began wandering aimlessly.
15532121.title: Samus impulsively confirms the upgrade.

choices: She is taken to an intergalactic arena
155321212.content:
The large, brutish woman that had once called herself Samus Aran wandered the empty hallways of the space station with little on her mind. Her feet pounded against the floor with each step she took, lightly shaking the discarded objects strewn about the facility. Her back hunched forward and her arms hung downwards in a neanderthal-like nature. Her hands were balled up into fists instinctively. The monstrous being had little sense of direction or care for where it was going. It simply kept walking. An idle hand reached towards one of her armpits as she continued down the hall. The armpit was covered in a tufted jungle of messy blonde hair, not unlike the patches of hair covering her arms and legs. Her rough, unkempt fingernails scratched the pit unhurriedly. She brought the hand to her face after a minute of scratching. Her hairy nostrils flared as she smelled the stinking scent coating her fingers. She stuck the two fingers into her mouth and continued unabashed.

After hours of stomping around the facility aimlessly, the beast came across a room full of rows upon rows of small, unfamiliar objects. If the brute was intelligent enough, it would've realized it had just walked in a circle around the station and had returned to the upgrade area. It, of course, didn't realize this. As it began to return to walking, a loud noise echoed in the room. A glowing net wrapped itself quickly around the beast. Its gigantic body was sent plummeting to the floor with a deafening boom. A strange, green creature revealed itself, speaking in an alien tongue. (not that Samus understood English at this point anyhow) The monster struggled with its bindings, its muscles bulging as it strained itself to break free. The net covering the beast produced an electric shock as it continued to fight.

Another shock of electricity jolted through its body. Then another. The creature's struggles subsided as its genitals flared with a pleasurable sensation. Its hand desperately reached for its vagina, held back by constraints. The messy haired woman rubbed her legs together as she reached her climax. She became soaked in her own juices before finally losing consciousness. Dark smoke billowed from her shocked body. The alien hauled her unconscious body back to its ship.
155321212.title: Captured Brute

15532122.content:
Eventually, the still rational part of Samus's brain won out. More power did sound nice, but she didn't like the idea of losing her intelligence. She might have been more aggressive, but she wasn't completely stupid.

So, Samus walked away from the screen. She decided that it might be worth it to try and explore the station more. Maybe she'd find something heavier to life. She really wanted a real chance to flex her new muscles.

As she walked down the hall, she neared another monitor. It suddenly sprang to life, jumping her a bit. Composing herself, she looked at the screen.

"Install Intelligence Upgrade for a mental boost, while retaining Amazon Upgrade? Y/N." It asked in a pleasent female voice. This caught Samus attention. Being strong and smart at the same time sounded perfect. She hit "Y" on the screen.

"Are you certain you wish to have this upgrade? Physical change may happen. Y/N." The screen flashed. Samus was a little concerned by that.

Does she still take the upgrade?
15532122.title: Still Rational

choices: She decides to test her muscle
She decides to test her brain
155321221.content:
Putting the physical change worry aside, Samus decided she would like an intelligence boost to go along with her muscle boost. She confirmed the upgrade. A small slot opened next to the monitor and the chip popped out. Samus took the chip and put it in her Zero Suit along with the Amazon upgrade.

Immediatly, she felt her head begin to tingle. Then, she saw a clump of yellow fall in front of her eyes, followed by more. Confused, Samus looked down and her eyes widened when she saw what it was: her hair. As her hair continued to fall out, she raced over to the mirror from earlier and looked. Her hair had fallen out, leaving her completely bald. But as she watched, another change took hold.

Samus gasped as the top of her head slowly began to swell. As it did, she felt her brain race. A million thought ran through her head at once. She thought of mathmatical equations and scientific formulas, engineering feets and battle stratigies. Her brain continued to inflate like a balloon as her mind raced.

Eventually it ended. Samus looked in the mirror in amazement. Her facial area was still normal sized, but brain had grown, leaving her with a bald dome the size of a beach ball. Samus rubbed her inflated dome in intrigue

"Oh my." Samus said to herself. "That upgrade caused my cranium to exponentially increase in size. And I can feel my intelligence has definately increased by several hundred numbers."

Samus looked again in the mirror, and chuckled. Her body was a 9 foot pillar of rock hard, bulging muscle. Meanwhile, she was also sporting a beach ball dome with an IQ probably in the thousands. She couldn't help but smile.

"I believe I have a achieved the perfect balance of brain and brawn." She said. "I must conduct an experiment. But what to test. My incredible musculature, or my immeasurable intelligence?"

What does Samus decide to test first?
155321221.title: Brain and Brawn

1553212212.content:
"As much as I would love to see how strong I am," Samus said, flexing one of her massive biceps. "I simply must investigate how smart I have become. After all, my cranial cavity and cerebrum did not grow for cosmetic reasons."

Samus then turned to the monitor. "Computer, please bring up the central computer grid for this vessel. I wish to see if I can make it function again."

The monitor did as it was asked. A keyboard appeared below it. Grinning, Samus began typing. Her fingers moved incredibly fast thanks to her new muscles. Samus's mind raced as she typed, repairing broken stings of code, creating new code for missing ones, bypassing security walls to access main servers, and so forth. Eventually, after a single minute, Samus was done.

"All systems back online." The computer said.

"Wonderful!" Samus replied. "I've proven at least some of my new genius intellect. This is fantastic. Computer, is there anything I should know about my two upgrades?"

"Searching..." The computer said. "Found:

"Amazon Upgrade: Enhances muscularity. Give superhuman strength and complete invulnerability. Also grants near infinite stamina. Drawbacks: increases agression and desire for battle.

"Intellect Upgrade: Increases brain and cranium size. Grants superhuman intelligence. Also grants psychokinetic abilites, including mind control, telepathy, and telekinesis. Drawbacks: increases ego."

Samus looked at the screen in amazement. "Psychokinetic abilities?" She asked herself. Then she looked at the huge boxes from earlier. Grinning, she focused her brainpower on them. Slowly, they began to rise off the ground. Overjoyed, she mentally stacked them into neat piles, and set them down.

"This is magnificent!" Samus declared. "But this is only one half of the equation! I must test how strong I have truly become!" She then left the upgrade hall in search of an exercise room.

But before she could locate it...
1553212212.title: Brainpower

choices: A maintanance worker, looking nervous and... arosed...
15532122121.content:
The sound of something knocking over rang in her ears.

"What matter of inconvenience has come now?" Slowly, Samus made her way to the sound, trying to keep as quiet as possible. Luckily, with her musculature upgraded, she was able to remain surprisingly stealthy despite her now large size. As she crept up on the sound, she spotted the dark silhouette of a smaller figure. With lightning speed, she thrust out her hand and gripped onto the figure.

Pulling it up to her eyes, she saw it was...
15532122121.title: Visitor

choices: Samus hacks the ship with her brainpower
Samus fights off the intruders head on
155321221212.content:
A space pirate snarled and kicked at her as it tried to escape her grasp.

"Futile." Samus remarked as her super powered muscles barely felt the pirates desperate attacks. Samus's overclocked brain began to analyze the situation. Judging by the pirates armor and weapons it was an advanced scout of a raiding party.

"So, thought you could get the jump on me while your comrades prepare to board the station?" Samus flexed her biceps and began to choke the struggling pirate. "Why dont you enlighten me of your plan and maybe I shall let you live."

"Youll never get anything from me!" the pirate choked out.

Samus began to concentrate on the pirate's mind. Her advanced brain began to pick though the space pirates memories, searching for the information she needed. Samus's cranium throbbed as she found what she was looking for. Her brain swelled slightly as the knowledge was absorbed into her mind. Samus let out a slight moan as she felt the increased brain power permeate her being.

"Aha! Looks like they plan to board the station from the starboard side. I have complete knowledge of their weapons and personnel." Samus exited the now unconscious pirates mind. He slumped to the floor in a daze.

"It seems as though I have two options. I may use my advanced intellect to hack into their ship as it approaches the station, or I can wait for them to come and try a more violent approach."
155321221212.title: A space pirate spy

15533.content: What about the Gel upgrade?
15533.title: Gel?

choices: She finds an odd side effect...
155331.content:
"The Gel upgrade." Samus said, selecting the upgrade. Since she hadn't found many yet, Samus was pleasantly surprised when it turned out to be a power suit upgrade, and quickly inserted it into her suit.

Samus waited a moment, and her suit glowed brilliantly, turning almost white in a brilliant shine, before ending abruptly, leaving Samus without any armor, and for some reason completely naked, missing her zero suit. Samus looked around her bare body for what had happened to her suit, feeling a strange weight in her chest, much heavier than usual. After a quick inspection of her body turning up clean, Samus noticed that her skin had a very shiny, almost rubber-like quality to it. She also felt strangely light for some reason, and saw a blue tinge go over her skin, spreading quickly over the rest of her body, her skin becoming smoother and even shinier. Samus held up her arm to see what had happened, and gasped in surprise as she saw through her hand! Her arm had gone transparent, the blue color turning deeper and richer as it took on a goo-like appearance, the rest of her body following suit. Samus began to run towards the mirror, but found her steps short, and the room seemed to get larger every time. Samus looked down, and saw that her legs were melting into a puddle of slime! The melting reached her waist, and Samus flailed about, trying to move as she slowly melted into just a puddle of slime.

A minute later, after Samus had calmed down from the process of melting and realized that she could still see, tried to move her eyes around, her field of vision sliding around the puddle. She realized that she still had control over what was now her body, and imagined herself as she was before, fully human and normal. Her body began to from together, rising up to form one mass, shaped like on Samus Aran. Having regained the use of her limbs, Samus took a wavering step forward, her foot slipping apart as she desperately willed it to stay together, and took another, slowly getting used to the odd feeling of her slime body, and made it over to the mirror, her body becoming more and more cohesive with each passing moment. She looked at herself in the mirror, and examined her changes.

She was made of a bright blue shiny gel, slightly transparent, and every one of her features was smooth and blue. Her face was arranged and looked the same as before, but when she opened her mouth she lacked a throat past her mouth, and her eyes were simply an indentation that looked like them, despite still being where she could see. Her genitalia were gone, smooth orbs and lines where they used to be, making her appearance naked, but not indecent. On the back of her head her gel had arranged itself to look like her hair, one blob that acted like a very stuck together form of her ponytail. But in her chest, she found the source of her heavy feeling. A small glowing orange core shone from her chest, seeming to be where her armor went, and what kept her cohesive and together.

Samus tried to manipulate her body, sprouting an extra arm and controlling it perfectly, reducing herself to a puddle and back, stretching and compressing into various shapes, manipulating the general shape of her body. The only limitation seemed to be that her core needed to remain in contact with the rest of her, and she was unable to move it out of her slime anyway. She also found that she didn't need to concentrate to hold her human shape, it seeming to have set itself as her default shape.

"…" Samus said, what was her mouth flapping uselessly. "…!" Samus attempted to yell, still entirely silent, lacking any vocal chords or anything to form the sound.

"…!" She attempted to yell again, trying to figure out how to form vocal chords and lungs.

What does she do?
155331.title: Gel upgrade

choices: Samus leaves the ship to consume more things.
1553311.content:
"Hmm…" Samus thought to herself. She would have said it to herself, but she couldn't talk ever since she got stuck in that Gel upgrade. She was currently trying to figure out a way to get off the satellite, and since it didn't look like she was going to change back any time soon, get a hold of her new slime body. Rather than walking, she melted the bottom half of her legs and flowed across the floor in the puddle over to a room with a bunch of empty canisters and containers.

One thing she had had problems with was holding onto things, which had been a problem with controlling her ship, hence why she was still stuck on the abandoned satellite. Most of the time, anything she tried to pick up just fell through her, but she was holding onto them for longer and longer each time, and she had hope that she could hold things properly soon. She slid over to the pile of cans that she had amassed, shoving them over into a pile using brute force. They ranged from the size of her hand to the size of buckets, and there were plenty to make a clattering sound when she dropped them. Samus brought herself back into her humanoid form, bending over to pick one up. The can began to sink through her hands, but she quickly pulled it close to her chest to keep it steady, holding it there for just a second, almost holding it… Before silently cursing as it slid through her grasp and into the area that appeared to be her stomach, floating there for a second.

Samus wordlessly sighed, preparing to expel it from her body, when she found that it seemed to be dissolving quickly in her body, her orange core glowing brighter than usual. Normally she would have removed it anyway, but she found that the tingling feeling that she got from it was… Kind of nice. The tingling feeling disappeared quickly as the can dissolved completely, and Samus found herself wanting to experience it again. She picked up another small can and shoved it into herself before she dropped it, the dissolving and tingling starting up again, and ending as quickly as it started. Samus was beginning to enjoy herself, and wondered what she looked like when her body was removing the cans from her. She decided to find out, and formed her body into an indistinct mass, pushing the pile of cans rather loudly over to the mirror, not minding the one or two that fell into the thick gel and disappeared quickly.

Samus reached the mirror, forming herself back into her human form and picking up another canister, pushing it into herself and watching her reflection as her core glowed and it disappeared. She noticed at the back of her mind that the small can seemed to be a little smaller than usual, but she put it out of her mind as she shoved another can into her, ignoring the thoughts that this might be a little addicting. Samus found that when she put more into her, the tingling of the removal process got stronger, and quickly started to pile the can into her, disregarding the shape and size of them as she wordlessly sighed and moaned in pleasure, not noticing an additional effect of the removal process.

A few minutes later, Samus' high finally ended as she found that she was out of metal to consume, and gave herself a minute to recover. While that had been wonderful, maybe it had been a bit overboard… Wait, what was that in the mirror? Samus turned herself around somewhat slower than usual to look at herself in the mirror, and her mouth opened in a gasp at what she saw.

If it was possible for a heap of slime to look like an obese woman, Samus had managed it. Apparently, the removal process converted the materials into gel and added it to Samus' body, and with her mind focused on keeping her human form, she had grown… Outwards. Her belly was huge and rolled with waves of slime, while her breasts were huge and her hips impossibly wide, with thighs to match. Her face had rounded with a second chin and wide face, and Samus was very surprised by the whole look. After she had gotten over her shock at her bigger body, she remembered that she had complete control over her body, and could just restore herself to her regular state. She reduced herself to a puddle, and built herself back up to her regular human shaped body. This time, she also found a slightly different change.

With the excess gel having to go somewhere, she was now almost double her normal size, towering over the room, approaching the roof, even at its high altitude. Samus was shocked at the change, her orange core appearing tiny around her huge body. She didn't know how to deal with it, until she remembered the wonderful feeling she got from the process that got her bigger. And besides, it wasn't like she really had anything to lose, did she? She didn't bother pretending to rationalize herself any further as she walked over a large metal crate, oozing over it with little regard for whatever could have been inside, her body growing as it dissolved inside her. Now even bigger than before, Samus realized that she just couldn't get enough of the feeling, and that she was going to run out of things to consume soon. She decided to focus her efforts on regaining control of her ship. After all, it was a big galaxy, and there was plenty of unwanted things for her to eat…
1553311.title: Odd side effect

15533111.content: With the thought in her slimy head and the feeling becoming harder to resist, Samus made her way to her ship. Even despite her large size, it was easy for her to slip in and get comfortable. However, she remembered that she had to find a way to grip objects without risking consuming them. Samus silently sighed before she noticed how filthy her ship was, empty ammo canisters and broken armor relics everywhere. Her gel mind slipping off, Samus made her way to the cans and 'chowed down' so to speak. Her body began to grow and grow even more with the intake until a part of her dripped inside her ship. From this, Samus' pleasure addled mind formed a plan and kept eating. Her body began to seep into the ship and all over it. By the time Samus was done, her body had a hold on the entire ship. The orange core of her body glowed a different color and the ship roared to life. With a slime, Seamus pioleted her ship, thinking of a planet just ripe with garbage for her to enjoy.
15533111.title: Samus leaves the ship to consume more things.

choices: Samus goes to the frontier planet.
Samus goes to the trash planet.
155331112.content:
As Samus flew through space, she amazed at how this felt. She was an enormous, amorphous blob, completely in control of her spaceship. The idea would have sounded odd at best and abhorrent at worst before she'd used the upgrade, but now Samus couldn't imagine anything wrong with this if she tried. It felt so amazing to dissolve and digest things into herself, and there was something that filled her with awe as she became larger. Being able to pilot the ship this way was something great too; she had control of every part of the ship, and had quickly brought up star charts and planet guides.

Nearby, there was a planet that was a minor member of the Galactic Federation, mostly a frontier world. Surely they had a lot of trash for her to eat for them, right? Of course, it was a bit further away, but there was also a landfill planet she could head to. It was completely abandoned, and trash was dumped there automatically by ships that never even entered the atmosphere. It would be the ultimate buffet, and she'd never have to interact with any people.
155331112.title: Samus the Ship

choices: They take Samus up on her offer, and she's given the location of their landfill.
They turn Samus down, so she heads to the opposite end of the planet.
1553311121.content:
It took a bit of thought, but in the end Samus had to be more interested in the planet that was actually populated by other people. After all, while Samus loved to cultivate the image of the lone wolf, out on her own for years at a time, she still did like to interact with other people when she could. There was another reason for the decision as well, one Samus wasn't even conscious of at the time. But as she sped off towards the planet, she read more about it in her computer systems. The planet was named Chysak, a recently settled world on the boundaries of Galactic Federation control. The settlers had build a single colony, and the environment was varied around the planet, not unlike Earth. The area around the colony, that was named the same thing as the planet it was on, was dry and desert-like, with the settlers farming all the things they needed. They were a self-sufficient, stoic bunch, apparently, who chose this planet for the freedom it would give them.

With that in mind, Samus send them a message once in-orbit, so as not to surprise them. She let them know that she was a bounty hunter, the famous Samus Aran, but that she'd recently undergone a strange transformation that had caused her to need to eat a lot of inorganic matter to survive. It was a bit of a fib, but it was better than telling the whole truth. She requested the ability to eat their refuse and trash, and in return she'd protect them.
1553311121.title: To the Borderworld Chysak

choices: By accident, Samus eats a native animal and finds it’s a new experience.
Within the day, Samus has devoured all the rocks in the canyon.
15533111212.content:
It took an entire day for Samus to receive a reply, while she waited in orbit, trying to resist to urge to devour the ship itself from the inside in her hunger. The message was pretty simple. “We thank you for the offer, but we have our own ways of handling our refuse. Please do not approach our colony.” With that idea thrown out, Samus decided to land on the opposite end of the planet, on a large continent completely unconnected from the one the colony was on, to maximize distance from them.

Once she’d successfully landed, Samus released the hole through which she normally exited and entered her ship, but was now nothing more than a funnel to release herself onto the ground below. Luckily, she’d specifically landed in a quarry at the bottom of a canyon, full of inorganic things for her to devour. Samus wasted no time in that either, happy to finally be able to indulge in this body’s specific needs.

What Samus hadn’t really noticed was that, at the time she left the ship, she’d absorbed enough matter to be a giant gel glob big enough to barely fit inside a swimming pool. In no time at all, she started growing past that, absorbing the boulders and rocks around her. It felt different than Samus had expected, as everything else she’d absorbed before had been artificial things from a ship, but the resulting dissolving as the mass become more of her, more goo, felt just as good. Mindlessly, Samus roamed the canyon doing what she’d come to this planet to do: eat.
15533111212.title: Canyon Slime

choices: Samus decides to continue on the canyon for now.
Samus leaves to find more alien animals to eat.
155331112121.content:
Just beyond the edge of Samus’s blobby mass, as she searched around for more boulders to devour, a small animal looked at her with curiosity. It was a native form of life, a local herbivore not unlike one of Earth’s squirrels, and it found the large blue creature very interesting, something totally new to this planet. Sadly for the animal, Samus shifted her body to move in a different direction, and in the process the creature was brought into her body, where it quickly dissolved and was added to her mass.

This event immediately caught Samus’s attention: this feeling was something new. What had she just absorbed? It had been small, but it had tasted...better, somehow. The feeling it gave her upon assimilation more rich and textural. Then, she felt new memories in her mind: that of the entire little animal’s life, from birth to sudden unexpected death. It didn’t quite feel like Samus had lived it all herself, but she could view any potion as an outside observer.

She...had eaten a living thing, swallowed it whole and killed it. The thought was a little disconcerting. It made her new body feel more monstrous. But she had to ask herself, was this really any different? After all, it was just a small, non-sapient animal. Samus had eaten meat when she’d had to, killed for it even when necessary to survive. Of course, she hadn’t needed that to survive in this case, but who really cared? Plus, she could use the animal’s memories to find the location of where more of them lived. It had felt so much better eating it, why not gorge herself on more of the creatures?
155331112121.title: Tasting Life

choices: Samus goes to eat the large animals.
Samus goes to eat the lone human.
1553311121212.content:
Unable to think of a good response to that idea, Samus switched tactics. Looking through the small creatures memories, she saw there was a whole underground nest of the creatures not far away. Samus moved over to the ground above their hive and, slowly, began seeping into every tunnel that connected them to safety. Seeing what was coming, the small animals went into the deepest part of their home, hoping it would protect them.

It did not. Samus was easily able to seep that far underground, and within minutes she’d absorbed and digested every single one of the animals in the nest, more than three dozen of the creatures. They didn’t add much mass to Samus, but they did bring her that extra-special sensation she’d had before, and give her access to their combined memories. Samus knew now how much she enjoyed absorbing living things, and she wanted more.

Looking through their memories, she quickly found something more exciting to try eating: another local herbivore, but one that was more than twenty feet tall, a mammalian creature with scaled flesh and a bulky body. Even with her immense size, something like that would be a challenge, but Samus couldn’t deny that the idea of how much larger she’d become from eating them was exciting. But then, she saw something else in a memory: a human colonist lived nearby, in a small shack, all on his lonesome. What remained of her humanity told her that eating a human being was just wrong, but Samus couldn’t deny the idea of eating a person sounded so interesting. There would be so much more to gain from their minds, after all.
1553311121212.title: Eating the Whole Nest

choices: Samus takes her ship to the colony and eats all she can.
Samus’s conscience gains a foothold, and she tries to take the upgrade out.
15533111212122.content:
Perhaps if this dilemma had appeared to Samus sooner, on the spaceship or when she’d first entered the canyon, her remaining human morality would have been enough to win out against her new gel body instincts. But what remained of that part of her was too weak to do anything more than feel bad about what was inevitably to happen, as Samus’s enormous slimy body moved through the woods towards her new target.

Once she’d successfully found the cabin, Samus did her best to stay out of sight, watching and waiting. There was nothing the man could likely do once Samus attacked, but she didn’t want to take the chance. The human looked so foreign to her now, so unlike the body she’d become adjusted to over time. It was impossible for her to even necessarily make out particular details, as the whole of him was so alien.

After the creature stopped tending to his meager crops outside his wooden cottage, he went indoors, just as the sun was beginning to set. Samus waited a few more hours, just to be certain she was catching him asleep, then attacked. She engulfed the entire house, began dissolving the material, while also seeping inside it to devour everything inside as well, including the human. He’d been asleep, and only barely managed to wake up before being consumed, with the rest of his property. The feeling this time was absolute ecstasy for Samus, and she had to wonder how she’d never considered this before. The memories and information she got from his mind was something, all right, but the actual feeling of digesting him was what really made the experience to fantastic. Samus knew now that she needed more, more humans, as soon as was possible.
15533111212122.title: Man-Eater

choices: Within a month, Samus is large enough to devour the planet itself.
After a while, Samus starts budding into more slime creatures.
1553311122.content:
Deciding to go with the instincts of her goo body (more trash meant more food), Samus took the longer trip out to KRE-5542b. As the size and scope of the Galactic Federation grew, it became inevitable that trash was going to accumulate, no matter how good their recycling was. Eventually, they designated doomed planets, ones set to slowly fall into their stars, as places to store all the trash. It was a lot safer than going close to the stars themselves, after all. By the time Samus had reached the planet, she didn't even wait to land and just ejected her massive slime body out.

What she found was everything she could have wanted, and more. She could almost see the end of the hall...but saying she could almost see it was a stretch. Even so, Samus saw no more reason to dilly-dally. She quickly went about scanning the upgrades. As she scanned them, she noticed that some of them had odd names. Take the Succubus Upgrade, for instance. Samus raised an eyebrow at that one, for sure. Another thing she noticed was that some of the upgrades were actually designed to augment her Zero Suit instead of her Varia suit. There were also upgrades for her morph ball, but that was no surprise. Eventually, she managed to get through them all. Turning around, she looked back at all of the upgrades she had just scanned. Now all that Samus had left to do was to pick one and use it. But which one?

She opened her Heads-Up Display and went to the Upgrades file for her suit. Now she had a large list of upgrades to choose from. Hm...Raptor? No...Shark? No...Armadillo...that's for the morph ball, isn't it? I'll keep that one in mind...Gel? She went through the entire inventory, keeping a mental list of the ones she was considering for actual use. Then she came to the Medieval Upgrade. What is this? It resembled a small badge with a red cross on it. The badge was shaped like a shield, and was a sky blue in color with a silver outline. Her visor added that it was compatible with her Varia suit as a whole. Like the other upgrades, its function and purpose were unknown. Samus thought about it for a moment...a shield badge? Maybe it was some kind of weapon augmentation. Maybe it was a shield. Samus couldn't say for sure. But, in the end, it was a safe bet. A safer bet than some of the other upgrades, at least. After a few minutes, Samus eventually decided to use the Medieval Upgrade. If it worked, she might even be able to pick another one from the same hallway.

She walked down to where the Medieval upgrade was. It wasn't too far from the end of the hall. When she found it, Samus stopped and got a good look at it. The upgrade itself wasn't that big. In fact, it could fit in the palm of her hand it was so small. Some of the other upgrades were the size of her morph ball, some of them were even bigger. Samus decided that the smaller her upgrades were, the better. Especially when she considered that she didn't truly know what any of the upgrades did. She let out another sigh. Let's do this...before I change my mind...

With that, she picked up the miniature shield. She held it up in front of her visor and gave it another scan. The readout explained that the upgrade had to be placed on the right side of her chest plate in order to take effect. It also said that the upgrade would add to her arsenal, as well as slightly change the look of her Varia suit. After thinking it over, Samus placed the upgrade, and looked down to see what it changed. The badge seemed loose at first, almost like it was a refrigerator magnet. But suddenly, the badge began to transform, molding to fit her chest plate. Once it was done, the badge began to vibrate, and Samus watched as sky blue lines seemed to magically draw themselves across the surface of her suit. When the lines reached her arm cannon, it began to change its shape. The barrel seemed to fold into itself, as the chamber and charger began to shift into different positions. Then, without warning, a neon blue blade shot out where the barrel used to be, the rest of her cannon folding around it until Samus could feel her right hand holding onto some sort of handle underneath the cover of the cannon.

Then the blue lines reached her left arm. Samus watched as her left gauntlet began to change.It started glowing the same blue color her new blade was, and the armor on her arm began to shift. Once the armor pieces finished moving, a large, blue shield shaped almost exactly like the badge itself appeared, along with two energy-based ties and a handle for Samus to grab onto. As this was happening, the blue lines continued to snake around her suit, changing the color of some parts of her armor, while completely modifying other parts. Sometimes, the blue lines were followed by silver outlines, which only served to make the suit look even cooler. In other places, the armor was modified to stick out farther from her body, giving the Varia suit a new, sharper, rougher exterior. The familiar green lights of the Varia suit became neon blue. As a finishing touch, her visor became a similar hue. Once this was all done, the blade slid back inside her arm cannon, the normal barrel folded back over her arm, the shield disappeared, and her left gauntlet folded all of the moved armor chinks back into place.

Samus stared down at her new suit. It was totally different that what she had expected. But, considering what she had just seen, that wasn't necessarily a bad thing. She quickly opened her HUD and went to her Upgrades tab. Now her Medieval Upgrade file had a complete description. She was just about to read it, when she noticed something moving on her motion tracker...slowly...

What is this mysterious thing that has managed to sneak up on Samus? An enemy of some kind? Or is it...the station itself, activating its defenses?

15533222222222211.content:
Samus froze. Something was behind her...and moving closer every second. She couldn't believe she had let something sneak up on her like that. Still, whatever it was, it appeared to be moving slowly. And it was...above her? The vents! Before she could move, one of the grates in the ventilation shaft running across the ceiling opened, and something came out of it...but it didn't land on the floor. She heard a clicking sound as something metal poked her in the back of the head.

"Hi there, Sammy," the thing hanging out of the grate said. "Looks like I gotcha."

Dammit! Samus thought, How did I let him sneak up on me like that? Time seemed to stop as Samus began to think of a way out of her plight. Based on the tone of his voice, I'd say he's a reptilian life form. The sound I heard was the hammer of a red shell revolver being pulled back. That weapon in particular is popular among reptilian species for some reason. It's powerful...and illegal. A point blank shot can put a hole through the toughest of metals. I can't let him hit me...not in the head. I have to take him out without letting him get a round off on me. The first thing to do is get his weapon away from him. Based on what I heard, he's holding the red shell with both hands. Based on that, I can do two things from this position. I could go into morph ball mode and roll under him, but if he shot me while I was morphing, it would cause serious damage. The only other option is to turn and use my forearm to knock his weapon out of his hands. Then I'll pull him out of the vent and incapacitate him accordingly. I have to time this just right. He's taunting me, which means he's arrogant enough to try and humiliate me before I die. Typical tough-guy bravado. He'll make his own opening, and when he does, I'll take him down.

"You know...it's really a shame," the thing continued, "I thought you would be more of a challenge."

Samus tensed up a bit. This is it...

"But, I guess I should be glad. After all, if I had to face you head-on, I'd probably lose." That was when Samus struck. She whirled around in an instant, using her arm cannon to smack his revolver right out of his hands. Samus was now face-to-face with her assassin. It was some kind of reptilian creature, with green scales and brown leather. He was hanging upside-down out of the vent, probably by means of an extremely strong tail. His yellow eyes were wide with surprise, his mouth hanging open. Samus acted quickly, grabbing her foe's upper jaw with her left hand and slamming his head into the ground. She then picked him up by the tail and threw him over her shoulder, charging up her arm cannon simultaneously. Before the creature even hit the ground, Samus turned and let her charge shot fly. The large energy ball slammed into his shoulder, sending him spinning through the air. He hit the ground hard, rolling several times before he crashed into the wall at the end of the hall.

The thing hardly had the chance to move an inch before Samus appeared in front of him. He opened his mouth, but before he could say anything, Samus put her arm cannon into it. The green reptile quickly put his hands up.

"Fffo't fffoot! On't fhoot!!!" The thing cried, his voice muffled by the arm cannon lodged in his mouth. Samus knew what that meant. She quickly pulled her arm cannon out and shook the spittle off of it. The reptile coughed a bit, wiping his mouth with his left hand. "Holy...motha...of shit..." the thing said, panting. "Oach...that was...wow...agh..." Samus immediately pointed her cannon at his head. The creature put his hands up again. "Woah, woah, take it easy, aight?" it said nervously. "Look, I don't want no trouble...I mean, yeah, I did try and kill ya, but I mean, come on...it's all part of the job, right?"

Samus raised an eyebrow. He wasn't exactly doing a good job convincing her not to kill him. She opened her scanning visor and gave her adversary a good look. He was a green reptile-looking thing with a short snout, a long tail, and bright yellow eyes that had black slashes for pupils. He was a small little thing, probably only about three feet tall at the most. He was dressed from head to toe in leather: leather boots, leather chaps, a leather vest with leather straps...even leather gloves. He had a hat, too, but it had fallen off when he popped out of the vent. His entire outfit was a soft brown, though every once in a while you might find a gold button or two. He was wearing two hip holsters as well, one empty, one holding a second red shell. His scales were quite thick, almost a centimeter thick each. They jutted out from his body like the teeth of a chainsaw. He had four long fingers on each hand, and long black claws to go with them. Oddly, enough, his feet had five toes, each one with a black claw of its own. He had glistening white fangs, two long fangs poking at at the corners of his mouth.

The visor identified him as a Kaldranian. That made sense. Kaldra was covered with reptilian creatures just like this one. Surely no one would miss him. Samus began to charge up her arm cannon.

"No, wait, wait a minute! Don't shoot me! Please, I'm beggin' ya! I didn't want to kill ya, honest! I just needed the dough! That's all, I swear to God!" He closed his eyes tight and looked away as he talked, expecting to lose his head at any moment.

Samus blinked. Someone put a bounty on me? Who? She deactivated her cannon.

The green lizard opened an eye and sighed with relief. "Jeez louisus, man. You scared the everlovin' fuck outta me, ya know that?"

Samus shook her head. Who taught you your manners? There was a brief moment of silence.

"Man...you don't talk much, do ya?"

What should Samus do now? Tie up her prisoner and continue to explore the station, or bring him to the Galactic Federation for questioning?

Any disappointment was quickly swept aside, however, as it quickly became clear that she was getting a message from her contact with the Galactic Federation. They had a new bounty for her, and it was one they recommended to her personally. She could immediately see why.

Gaston LaRouge was a human diplomat working with the Federation, specifically involved in directing coordination between the Federation's legislative branch and arms dealers. What had only been recently discovered, through the work of several private investigations, was that Gaston was not only corrupt, purposefully changing communications rather than giving them faithfully, but he'd been a plan working with the Space Pirates, making sure they were well armed whenever possible, giving them access to technology from the Galactic Federation. He was on the run now, last seen on a luxury borderworld outside the Federation's jurisdiction. He was wanted dead or alive.

Samus was all too happy to test out her new body in taking in this monster. The best way to get this done, she immediately thought, would be to use her new form to her advantage, pose as someone working with Ridley, with the Space Pirates. Then, once they'd had a chance to meet, Samus could take him with ease. Of course, there were also risks with that plan. And wouldn't it be easier, more simple, to just go in full-force? 15533222222222222211111.content:
As much fun as it would be to play this simply, Samus knew a thing or two about the planet he was hiding away in, Bliss. Part of the reason scum like LaRouge felt so comfortable going there was that, aside from laying outside the regular bounds of Federation law enforcement, Bliss had a private army, and they made damn sure that no one did the exact kind of thing Samus had been thinking of. She was tougher than usual like this, to be sure, but she wasn’t foolish enough to test it on a suicide mission.

Getting in to Bliss was easy, Samus had more than enough credits in her account to pay for a weekend stay, even at the exorbitant prices they demanded. No, her larger issue was transportation. While Bliss wouldn’t likely care about Samus’s ship, if the target found out about it, he’d run. After all, Samus Aran was known throughout the galaxy as the number one enemy of the Space Pirates. So, Samus stored her ship with someone she trusted and rented a refurbished scout ship that once belonged to the Space Pirates, and still largely retained that design. It took some time for Samus to get used to the different controls, but by the time she’d reached her destination, she felt like her little scheme was coming together beautifully.

It hadn’t taken much greasing of palms to find out where LaRouge was spending his time and money, and Samus entered that particular casino looking how she felt: the strongest, most badass woman in the goddamn galaxy. Quite a few eyes were on her, and as she approached LaRouge, she could tell his were among them. Whether the bastard was looking at her in fear or in lust, Samus was satisfied. “You’re LaRouge, right?” she asked, her voice a rumbling growl as she managed to show off quite a few razor-sharp teeth with her question.

The target would likely be considered handsome, Samus supposed. He was a human, pale with a well-groomed beard and slicked back hair. His clothes were tailored to perfectly fit his athletic build, and a buxom Castranian woman was hanging on his arm, who looked even more scared of Samus than LaRouge did. “I’ve never seen a female space dragon before,” he said, looking as though he was trying to recover his ‘rich man of power’ persona.

“We look like this,” Samus told him, enjoying seeing the worm squirm as she spoke. “My cousin Ridley sent me to see you. Since you were so sloppy that you ended up being a wanted man by the Federation, you’re going to need my protection. We want to...make sure you don’t talk.” The threat in her words was barely even concealed, and that’s the way Samus wanted it.

LaRouge took in her words, clearly thinking them over a little before giving any sort of answer. “Well, I suppose that makes sense. Though I never realized Ridley had a cousin...or that he was even still alive. Well then, I leave my protection in your care.” This had been so simple, Samus was astounded. This empty-headed buffoon had just led himself to the woman most ready to turn him in for the money. But that led to a new question...should she end the charade so early? Maybe she could take her time, squeeze more information out of him first, so she could go wreak havoc on more of the Space Pirate menace...

The opportunity that had fallen into her lap...she’d hated the Space Pirates her entire life. Fighting them was what kept her going. Getting leads on how to put an even larger wrench into their plans? It was perfect. So Samus took stance a few feet behind LaRouge, and let him continue his gambling.

It took a while for the snake to get back into the good mood he’d been in before Samus had intruded, but once he was, the laughter and seducing of women only interested in his credits was back. It was dull, really, but Samus was well used to tedium. After a few hours of following the criminal, he turned to look at Samus, only the slightest hint of fear in his eyes as he met hers. “Don’t you want to enjoy yourself too?”

What Samus immediately wanted to do was snap at him that crushing his windpipe between her teeth would be very enjoyable, but let the comment slide down her throat without being spoken. Instead, she just growled, “I’m working.” LaRouge rolled his eyes, but before he turned back to the game of Quasar he’d been playing, Samus asked him something back. “Why?” When it became clear he wasn’t sure what she meant, Samus clarified. “Why’d you betray the Federation for the Space Pirates?”

The question had eaten away at her, ever since reading his file. For all her time fighting them, Samus didn’t know why anyone worked with, or joined, the alien villains. There may have been another, hidden motive to the query as well. One Samus still couldn’t see within herself. For the first time, Samus saw defiance on the beaurocrat’s face. “I’m no coward. I support the Space Pirates because of what they are: strength. Unrelenting, indomitable strength. No complex court structure, no votes...they just get things done.” That gave Samus something to think on later, but Samus became immediately alert: she noticed someone approaching, from LaRouge’s back, another bounty hunter. She had to move quickly: would she protect LaRouge or help the bounty hunter?

To begin, her zero suit began to sparkle, Samus looking down to see why it had started doing so, and watched as the material of the zero suit start to change into thousands of shiny sequins, each the same light blue of her zero suit, glittering as she moved. The material began to loosen, hanging off her body rather than clinging to it, but remaining tight on her body, while the material on her legs merged into one sleeve, moving off her legs and into a dress, while leaving a thin layer behind.

The dress began to gain slightly length, almost touching the ground as it grew, while a slit ran up the side of her left leg, showing off her thighs and the layer underneath, which quickly changed into a pair of very thin, slightly transparent black stockings, showing off her legs, and occasionally the pair of lacy underwear that had also formed underneath above her stockings. On her feet, Samus quickly changed her posture to account for the pair of blue high-heels that her boots changed into, the heel reaching four inches as her pose switched into a more casual, alluring one.

Up top, Samus patiently watched her changes unfold, a smile growing as she grew pleased with the changes to her attire. After all, a dress like that would easily show off her body, get some looks while also distracting them… Samus walked over to the mirror, gracefully carrying herself as she reached it, moving around slightly to get the best look at herself as her changes continued.

The material on her arms receded from her shoulders and upper arms, leaving Samus with a pair of gloves, which grew thicker and looser, lightening into a pair of white, shiny silk opera gloves. The fabric continued to recede down her chest, leaving her chest down to her cleavage, the dress pushing up and emphasizing that section, her breasts swelling slightly to match. On her ears, a pair of sapphire earrings were pierced through, hanging slightly from her ears in a diamond shape, while the band holding her hair in a ponytail disappeared, letting her hair spill down her shoulders, growing slightly smoother and shinier, completing her changes.
