Samus stared at her cards, her perfectly calm and confident exterior hiding the fierce calculations going on underneath. This was the big moment. Win here, or lose half her winnings for the night, and possibly a chunk of her reputation. Keeping her perfect face? Easy. Suppressing the urge to show signs of pressure in body language, at even the most subtle gestures? Somewhat harder. Either way, she just had to get this one right. She hoped she had this, at least. Right now, it was down to her luck.

"I'm in." Samus said, deliberately oozing confidence, her opponent good, but not quite as good, his silent treatment betraying him slightly as he concentrated on his cards, eventually discarding and drawing one of them. The final hand went down, they lay their cards out, and…

"Well, looks like I win again. Better luck next time." Samus said, giving off another smile as her opponent fumed. Perhaps she'd gone a little too far in presentation, Samus thought to herself. The man looked ready to attack her over the huge sum of money she'd just won from him. Luckily for her, even if he had tried, and she had been unable to fight him off, which she was perfectly capable of doing, the incredibly burly bouncer, a rock-like species and a lot smarter than he looked, had been watching carefully to make sure neither of them had been cheating.

Samus smoothed off her dress and took her chips, and headed to cash them in, deciding that she figured she had done enough for the night. She didn't want to make too big of a haul for herself, seeing as her reputation for single-handedly cleaning out casinos had gotten her quite as few extra looks, in addition to the regular sort, which Samus appreciated equally.

She felt like she hadn't gone quite as far out as she could have, but she had decided to pull out of the roulette after her continual string of victories after the last time she had done a little too well at roulette at another casino. It was all down to her good luck, really, but the other gamblers hadn't quite seen it that way. She'd dealt with it, of course, but they had almost ruined her perfectly put together appearance, and she'd had to retire for the night that time.

At the moment, Samus had more than enough money to give her a life of riches, but she wasn't really in it for the money. She was in it for the life, for the thrill of it all… She had considered playing in the big leagues for some of the card games, but there was something about the casino that drew her to it, and made it worth coming back every night… But she was getting a bit too reflective, and focused on getting her winnings and getting out. She cashed in her chips, and was rewarded with a chip of her own, a sum of credits on a chip that some of rivaled some of the richest people in the galaxy's earnings, and a few icy looks from the employees of the casino. She tucked it into her cleavage and headed of, already thinking of where she was going to go the next night.

Either way, she decided to find out, and hey, if the thing worked as advertised, magic. She inserted the upgrade into her zero suit, and waited for the changes to begin.

She did, however, start to feel very unpleasant, like she was sick, but somehow not quite to the level of feeling nauseated or that any part of her body wasn't working properly. At the mirror, Samus initially didn't notice anything different about herself. But she had looked at her body first, and when she looked more closely at her face, she noticed that the color seemed to be draining out of her skin, going from a healthy tan to a sickly pale color, and then went beyond, into a inhumanly grey, not one that could be caused by any natural means.

Samus also felt her eyes start to hurt slightly, like if she hadn't closed them for a long time. She tried blinking and closing her eyes briefly, but the slight burning feeling continued, and she squinted slightly as she noticed that a similar process to what had happened to her skin was happening to her hair, the color draining out of it into a grey, while her hair became more ragged, becoming rougher and the shine going out of it. Her eyes widened at her now somewhat inhuman appearance, and she noticed that her irises had faded to grey, rather than their usual bright blue. However, the pain from having her eyes widened got to her quickly, and she went back to squinting, everything seeming to be far too bright for her.

As Samus tried to shut out the light by keeping her eyes shut as much as possible, for some reason, she started to feel depressed, like something was deeply upsetting and continued to be upsetting, but she couldn't figure out just what was bothering her. Combined with the lighting of the room hurting her and her feelings, she felt like she would just lash out at the first person to bother her, and this wasn't helped by her hands starting to hurt as they began to change.

Her hands began to ache, particularly around her digits, and Samus looked down to see her fingers growing at the first knuckles, growing four or five times as long, the fingernails at the ends growing out into sharp and extremely dangerous looking claws, easily able to tear someone apart. The fabric of her zero suit around her hands shredded at the growth, letting Samus see that her skin was just as grey around the rest of her body.

1553322222222222222222222222222221.content:
Samus continuously scrolled through the list of upgrades displayed on the terminal. She had seen so many strangely named upgrades so far, like the Pear Upgrade, the Balloon Upgrade, the Succubus Upgrade, the Gel Upgrade, the Genie Upgrade, and the Medusa Upgrade. With names like those, it was hard to figure out exactly what the uprages would do, and a surprisingly large number of those upgrades had been for her Zero Suit, rather than her Power Suit, meaning they probably wouldn’t be very useful in combat.

After several minutes of searching, Samus found something that caught her eye.

“The Data Upgrade,” said Samus. It was one of the many upgrades for her Zero Suit, but this one sounded like it might actually be useful, and she hoped it would provide a data bank or computer interface for her Zero Suit. A few button presses later, and the terminal presented the Data Upgrade. She picked up the upgrade chip and looked it over. It looked like any other upgrade chip, but it had a logo Samus had never seen before on it. There was a blue circle on one side, and inside the circle were four blue squares, arranged in a T shape.

Samus pressed the Data Upgrade into her Zero Suit’s upgrade slot and waited for the upgrade to take effect. Almost immediately, her Zero Suit started to change colour. Black squares appeared on her Zero Suit, spreading out from the upgrade slot until the Zero Suit had completely changed colour from blue to black. Glowing lines of purple light began to appear on her black Zero Suit, first forming on the back of her fingers. The glowing purple lines met in the centre of her hand, and a single line traced its way up her arms, stopping at her shoulders. Similar lines formed on her chest, running down the outside of her breasts, then trailing down to outline her hips. The glowing purple lines went down to her knees, where they split and formed the outline of her boots, and Samus noticed that her Zero Suit’s heels were now glowing purple as well. Finally, the logo that normally appeared on the back of her Zero Suit appeared on the centre of her chest, flashing bright purple.

Once the logo on her chest appeared, Samus felt a strange weight on her back. It certainly wasn’t heavy, whatever it was, but it was unexpected. She reached behind her back, and her hand closed around something. She pulled it off her back, and held it out in front of her. It looked like some sort of disc, or maybe a chakram, with a hollow inside, and there a faded purple line around the disc. Samus tightened her grip on the disc, and with a snapping sound the outer edge of the disc flared to life, glowing the same shade of purple as the lines on her Zero Suit, and the line on the disc itself also started to glow. Samus reached behind her back with her free hand, and felt some sort of dock, which must have been what her new disc had been attached to. Samus shut the disc off and returned it to the dock on her back.

Samus also felt a weight on her thigh, and she reached down and grabbed the item that had appeared on her leg. It looked like some sort of baton, with three circular purple lights on one side. Samus twirled the baton in her hands a few times, then took the baton in both hands and pulled. The baton split into two halves, and glowing purple lines of light began to form, spreading out from the baton and forming a wire-frame. Squares of black metal began to form, spreading out from the wire-frame and quickly forming a ground vehicle, a motorcycle of some sort.

“Interesting,” Samus said to herself as she looked the motorcycle over. She reached out to the baton, which had formed the handles of the motorcycle, and with a quick push, was able to make the motorcycle collapse back into the baton. Once the motorcycle had finished being disassembled, the two halves of the baton connected, and Samus attached it back to her thigh.

“So that upgrade gave me a motorcycle and some sort of disc,” Samus said to herself. The motorcycle would at least give her a decent form of transportation when she was out of her Power Suit for whatever reason, but she wasn’t sure what the point of the disc was. Maybe she could use it as a throwing weapon, or possibly in melee combat? While useful, she certainly didn’t see why it was called the Data Upgrade. Still, it would certainly be useful if she ever had to go somewhere and didn’t have access to her Power Suit.

Samus turned her attention to the terminal that had given her the Data Upgrade. Maybe the computer could tell her more about the Data Upgrade, or possibly find compatible upgrades to further improve the Data Upgrade. Or she could explore the station, and try to find some sort of training area. She wanted to try out the disc the upgrade had given her, and see if it could be used as a weapon. She also wanted to see how the motorcycle handled, and whether it had any other functions she was unaware of.

A glowing blue grid formed on Samus’ body, and the device fired the laser again, hitting one of the sections, causing that part of Samus to disappear. The device fired the laser rapidly, hitting each of the grid sections that had appeared on Samus, until her entire body had disappeared.

Samus felt a sudden rush, and fell backwards, landing on her butt. She closed her eyes and shook her head, feeling slightly nauseous from whatever the laser had done to her. When she opened her eyes, she immediately realised she wasn’t on the space station any more. As she watched, glowing lights in various colours began to light up on the walls and floor around her. 1553322222222222222222222222222221113.content:
Samus’ eyes nearly popped out of her head when she saw who was entering the room. The person who had spoken looked like a clone of her! She was even wearing the same form of the Zero Suit as Samus herself, complete with the disc attached to her back and the baton on her right leg.

“Wh... who are you?” Samus asked. “What are you?”

“To answer your second question, I’m a computer program that was created when you activated the Data Upgrade,” the woman said. As she spoke, Samus noticed that her voice had some barely audible digital modulation. As the woman got closer, Samus noticed that her pupils weren’t round. Rather, they were hexagonal.

“As for who I am... well, I don’t have a name yet,” said the woman with a shrug. “I was hoping you would give me one. After all, you are my User.”

“Wait, am I inside the space station’s computer?” Samus asked.

“That’s right,” said the program. “Welcome to cyberspace.”

The program stepped in front of Samus and held out her hand. Samus took it, and the program helped Samus to her feet.

“You called me a User,” said Samus. “What do you mean by that?”

“All programs have a User,” said the program. “The Users are the ones who created us. Programs never get to meet their Users, since they never end up in cyberspace.”

“I see,” said Samus. “Which means you’re a computer program?”

“Yes,” said the program. “Like I said, I was created when you first used the Data Upgrade. I’m programmed to teach you how to use the Data Upgrade, and to protect you when you’re in cyberspace.”

Samus nodded. “You said you didn’t have a name?”

“Yeah,” said the program. “Did... did you have anything in mind?”

Samus paused as she thought for a few seconds. “How about Virginia? It was my mother’s name.”

“Sure, I like it,” said the program with a smile. “I’m Virginia, nice to meet you.”

“Glad to meet you,” said Samus. “My name is Samus Aran. You said you were programmed to teach me?”

“Right,” said Virginia. She reached behind her back, and drew the disc that was attached to her back.

“When you activated the Data Upgrade, you received an Identity Disc,” said Viriginia. “Everything you do or learn will be imprinted on this disc.”

“So, it’s a data bank?” Samus said.

“For Users? Yes,” said Virginia. “For a program, it’s our whole identity. If I were to lose my disc, my memory would glitch. Eventually, the memory glitches would get so bad, I’d completely forget who I used to be.”

“Oh,” said Samus.

“Anyway, you can also use your Identity Disc as a weapon,” said Virginia. She tightened her grip on her Disc, and the edge flared to life with a snapping sound. “When it’s powered up like this, you can use it in melee combat, or throw it at your opponents to derez them.”

“Derez?” Samus asked.

“Short for deresolution,” said Viriginia. “It’s what happens to programs when they’re badly damaged and can’t survive.”

“It means they’re dead,” said Samus.

“That’s the User term for it, yes,” said Virginia, powering her Disc down and returning it to her back.

“And what about this?” Samus asked, grabbing the baton on her leg and holding it up for Virginia to see.

“That’s a Baton,” said Virginia. “You can install subroutines on it. Those subroutines allow the Baton to create weapons and vehicles, like the Light Cycle.”

“Is that the motorcycle it created earlier?” Samus asked.

“Yes, that’s the default subroutine,” said Virginia. “You can also install things like a Light Jet, a Light Staff, or a Light Cable.”

“I see,” said Samus. “Is that everything?”

“That’s the basics, yes,” said Viriginia. “If you want to leave, the Portal is currently active.”

“The Portal?” Samus asked. She looked behind her, and saw a stream of light reaching up into the sky originating from a platform a few metres away.

“That’s how you got in here from the User World, and it’s how you get back out,” said Virginia. “The Portal will stay open while you’re in cyberspace, and will close as soon as you leave.”

Samus nodded. She was glad to hear that there wasn’t a time limit to how long she could stay in cyberspace. That said, she wasn’t sure how long she wanted to spend in here with her digital copy.

155332222222222222222222222222222221.content:
"The Elastic upgrade," Samus said, selecting the upgrade from the machine. She wasn't exactly sure what the name meant, but all the other names were equally as vague, and it at least sounded like it had the potential to be interesting. Complying with her selection, the machine spat out a chip, which was apparently meant to be inserted into her zero suit. Exiting her power suit, Samus inserted the chip, and waited for the upgrade to take effect.

After a few moments, nothing seemed to happen. Nothing about her suit seemed to have changed, even after ensuring the chip was inserted correctly. "Maybe it was a dud," Samus mumbled, wondering if some of the upgrades simply didn't do anything. Maybe it just wasn't applicable to her. Her zero suit was already rather stretchy and elastic, after all, so perhaps it would have more use for other types of clothing. Although if that was the case, she wondered why it was made for her zero suit and not her power suit, as she could certainly see a case for why making her power suit more flexible would be useful.

Of course, there was always the possibility that the upgrade had indeed done something, and she just couldn't see it clearly. She could only see herself so well without the aid of a mirror, after all. Luckily, there was a mirror hanging from a nearby wall, presumably so that those testing the upgrades could observe whatever was happening. Deciding to see if the upgrade really had done anything, Samus walked over to the mirror.

Or more accurately, she tried to walk over to the mirror, upon taking her first step, her leg suddenly extended out far further than it should, stretching across the room. Caught off guard by this sudden impossible feat, Samus lost lost her balance, and fell face-down on the ground. Instead of feeling any pain, however, she felt her face squish and press flat against the ground, like a cartoon character crashing into a window. She slowly pushed herself up, her face regaining its original shape, realising what had happened; the upgrade didn't change her suit, it changed her body. Somehow, inserting the chip into her zero suit had altered her body to become stretchy and elastic. She wasn't entirely sure how the upgrade had managed to do such a thing, but she supposed that explained why there were so many upgrades for the zero suit within the archives of the research station.

Realising her foot was still halfway across the room, Samus attempted to reel it back in, returning her leg to its original length. She stood up, and tried to walk over to the mirror again, this time slower as she focused on keeping her limbs at their proper length. Eventually reaching the mirror, Samus carefully looked over her reflection, but found that, just as in her earlier examination, nothing seemed to be out of place. Even her skin seemed to be as normal as ever, despite the earlier evidence to the contrary. Putting her hands on her waist, Samus slowly pushed inwards. Instead of any sort of resistance that one would normally expect, her waist squished and compressed beneath her hands as if it were nothing. Similarly, it pulled and stretched outward when Samus grabbed at her sides and pulled. Throughout all of it, she didn't feel a single shred of pain, as if her bones were now rubber and couldn't be hurt. She had a feeling she could still experience pain, but crushing or stretching would no longer hurt her.

Seeing her body stretch in cartoonish ways was more than a little unsettling, but Samus couldn't deny the usefulness the upgrade had. She could reach things that would be too far away or too high, she could avoid damage from certain kinds of attacks, etc. Of course, she realised she could only put this stretchiness to use outside of her power suit, which limited its usefulness, but this didn't change the fact that this opened up new options for her. In the small time she'd been experimenting with the upgrade, she'd already managed to get the hang of only stretching when she wanted to, and not accidentally stretching like her leg first had. By all accounts, it seemed this first upgrade was a success.

She looked over at the terminal she'd gotten the upgrade, her body still facing the mirror while her neck stretched to allow her to look behind her. There were several other upgrades the research station held, which she could try out next, or perhaps even try in tandem with the Elastic Upgrade. There was also more of the station to explore if she so chose, and her newfound stretchiness would probably aid in that exploration. Of course, she could always just test the limits of the upgrade, and see exactly what she could do with her new stretchy body, there were plenty of options.

Whatever the case, she finally decided that her other self was being honest with her and charged the Paralyzer up. "For what it's worth..." she paused as she aimed the fully charged beam up at the other Samus' head, the bright light from the gun's energy illuminating both of their faces. "Thanks for making it easy on me I guess."

"Just don't expect the others to be the same way now that they know what Millie is up to." The other Samus warned ominously, before Samus released the trigger and saw her other self phased out of existence. Almost immediately Samus saw the world around her begin to fade. It was slow, almost unnoticeable, but it was happening. Looking around, Samus searched for a way out, but could find none, and so simply sat in the pilot seat of her gunship while the world around her disappeared permanently. Once the image of the gunship was completely gone Samus stood up and saw that she was back in the void once more.

"I guess when I defeat a guardian the mental barrier just- AH." Samus cried out, falling to her side as stabbing sensation suddenly erupted in her brain. "What's...happening..." Samus clutched her head, feeling the world spin around her as she felt herself slipping into unconsciousness from the pain itself. Millie... was the last thought Samus had before she lay still.

As she lay unconscious she felt more and more of her previous "memories" return to her. They weren't much, but the memories of meeting Millie in her childhood around the royal palace were much clearer, and Samus smiled at the sight. Outside however, while she was unconscious her body had been summoned back to Millie's room, the brunette watching over her with a cold smile as her girlfriend slept. "Excellent..." Millie giggled darkly, "guess you'll be of utmost use to me 'Sammie.' Even more so now that the transfer has started..." Millie looked over to the full length mirror. At first glance, nothing had changed about her, but upon closer inspection, the woman's previously full mane of brown hair now had a few strands of blonde in it. "Hm hm... Once she takes down enough barriers I'll have enough influence to do the rest myself...but for now...rest up Sammie." She smiled malevolently at Samus, who remined blissfully unaware of Millie's plot as she slept.

After waking...

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Samus browsed through the list of upgrades that were available. Many of the upgrades had names that didn’t really explain what exactly they were supposed to do. Not only that, but the vast majority seemed to be designed for the Zero Suit, rather than the Power Suit, like she was hoping.

After looking through the list for a few minutes, Samus found something that caught her eye. More accurately, it was two things, a pair of chips called the Centaur Upgrades. One was designed for her Zero Suit, while the other was designed for the Power Suit.

Which version of the Centaur Upgrade did Samus decide to try?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: The Centaur Upgrades.

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Since she was already in her Power Suit, Samus decided to try that version first. She tapped the screen to confirm her selection, and the terminal spat out the upgrade chip. Samus picked up the chip and slotted into her Power Suit, waiting for the Upgrade to kick in.

She didn’t have to wait long. Samus felt herself her lower body being forcibly remoulded inside her armour, similar to what she felt when she used the Morph Ball. She looked down, and watched as her boots were transformed into a hoof. She also felt her feet elongating inside her armour as her upper and lower legs grew shorter, with the end result being that Samus felt as if she was standing on her tiptoes.

Once her legs had finished changing, she felt a strange pulling sensation on her butt. She looked behind her, and saw her backside stretching out behind her as new armour plates formed. Samus could feel her flesh stretching to fill the new extension, and she felt new bones forming to support the new muscles and organs that were forming.

As her new body filled in, Samus could see more armour forming at the end of the extension. The armour stretched down to the ground, forming a pair of empty legs. Her body continued to shift and fill the empty armour. Samus felt her new rear legs forming inside the new armour. She felt as if she was tiptoeing with her rear legs, just like she did with her front legs, and Samus noticed that her rear legs also had a hoof.

Once her new legs had finished forming, Samus tentatively raised her front left leg. It felt almost the same as it normally did, so she set it back down again. She did the same with her front right leg, then tried to lift her rear left leg. To her surprise, her new leg lifted up easily. She set it back down again, and tested her rear right leg. With all four feet back on the ground, she slowly tried to walk forward. Samus was half-expecting her new back legs to stumble, but she found it incredibly easy to walk in this new form.

“The Upgrade must’ve rewired my brain so I can move like this,” Samus mused. That shouldn’t have been too surprising, since the Morph Ball did the same thing. After all, human minds weren’t exactly designed to handle rolling around as a featureless ball of flesh.

Now that she was confident that she could walk, Samus walked over to the mirror that was nearby and examined her reflection. While her upper body was unchanged, her lower body was incredibly different. For one thing, she now had four legs, and her rear legs were connected to her by a second torso, stretching out from her butt. Not only that, but her legs had been shifted around so that she was walking on her tiptoes, and her boots had transformed into hooves. She looked like someone had attached her upper body to the body of an old Earth animal called a horse.

How does Samus feel about the upgrade?

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
“Well, this is interesting,” Samus said to herself as she looked herself over again. “Wonder how effective it’ll be in combat, though...”

Samus stepped away from the mirror, then walked a lap around the room to get more comfortable with having four legs. As she grew comfortable with walking, she slowly increased her speed. Samus could hear her hooves clicking against the metal floor as she sped up to a trot. She felt like she was performing a light jog, but Samus also felt as if she was moving much faster than she would if she was jogging as a human. She decided to see just how fast she could go, and sped up into a gallop. Her hooves thudded against the floor as she instinctively crouched her human upper body down to reduce her air resistance. Samus was definitely moving much faster than any regular human could, and even faster than she could as a Morph Ball.

Satisfied with her speed test, Samus slowed back down again as she caught her breath, panting lightly. She felt her lungs heaving in her chest, and also felt the same feeling in her equine lower body. Samus could feel her horse torso expanding and contracting in time with her breathing, as a second pair of lungs worked to pull more air into her body.

“Guess I need more oxygen with this form,” Samus said once she stopped panting.

As her breathing steadied, Samus found that she’d found her new speed to be exhilarating. Not only that, but the more she thought, the more advantages she could see to having four legs. The enhanced speed was fantastic, and having an extra pair of legs meant Samus could gain a better footing on uneven terrain. The only problem was that she took up more space like this, but that could easily be remedied by removing the Centaur Upgrade.

“I’m definitely keeping this one,” said Samus.

Now all she needed to do was figure out what to do next. Samus remembered that there was a Zero Suit version of the Centaur Upgrade, and she was somewhat curious as to what that Upgrade would do to her. Of course, she also wanted to see how the Power Suit version handled in combat. Maybe there was some sort of training area on the space station? There were still plenty of other upgrades available for her to test, though. Maybe she could find something compatible with the Centaur Upgrade?

What did Samus decide to do?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: She loves it.

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
With the push of a button, Samus deactivated the Centaur Upgrade. With the Centaur Upgrade turned off, the changes made to her body began to reverse. Her rear legs were pulled up out of her armour, and her equine body started to pull back as well, pushing into her rear. The extra armour began to disappear as well, and her front legs began shifting back into a human form. Soon, it was all over, and she was back to normal.

Samus pulled her helmet off, and set it down on the terminal. She then pressed another button, and her Power Suit opened up. With the Power Suit opened, Samus stepped out of the set of armour, her heeled Jet Boots clicking against the metal floor. Once she was standing in front of the terminal, she tapped the screen to select the Zero Suit version of the Centaur Upgrade. A slot on the terminal opened up, and the chip slid out.

“Well, I liked the Power Suit version,” Samus said as she picked up the chip. “Let’s see how the Zero Suit version goes.”

Samus pressed the chip into the Zero Suit’s upgrade slot, and the changes began almost immediately. The fabric of her Zero Suit quickly retracted up her body, exposing her legs and hips. With the Zero Suit out of the way, Samus felt her legs shifting again. Her upper and lower legs grew shorter as her feet grew longer, and her toes fused together and hardened into a hoof. As her hoof formed, her Jet Boots formed into horseshoes, protecting the bottom of her hooves. She then felt her backside stretching out again, forming a horse body as her rear legs grew again. Once her back legs had formed, she felt a new pair of horseshoes forming on her rear hooves as well. Just as she thought her changes were done, she felt a tingling all over her equine body as short brown fur began to grow, covering her skin. Once her fur coat had grown in, she felt a tingling in her butt, and looked over her shoulder to see a tail of blonde horse hair forming.

“A tail?” Samus said. “That’s new.”

Once her transformation was complete, Samus slowly walked herself around the room. She didn’t feel all that different from how she’d felt when she used the Power Suit Centaur Upgrade. The only real difference was the addition of a tail. For some reason, the Power Suit version didn’t have a tail, or if it did, it was hidden by her armour. That did make sense, as having an exposed tail left something for an enemy to grab.

Once Samus had finished trotting around the room, she came to a stop in front of a full-body mirror and took a few minutes to examine her reflection. While both versions of the Centaur Upgrade had essentially done the same thing, the Zero Suit version gave her a much better look at her new equine body. Samus could see the new muscles rippling beneath the skin as she moved her new horse legs, and could see the rib-cage expand and contract in time with her breathing. She ran a hand over her flank, and felt the soft brown fur beneath her fingers.

Samus lifted up one of her front legs and looked down, trying to get a better look at the bottom of her hoof. She could just barely see the horseshoe that her Jet Boot had transformed into, and she could still see the glowing pattern that had decorated her Jet Boots. Had her Jet Boots been transformed into Jet Horseshoes? And if that was the case, would she still be able to use them?

“Hmm,” said Samus said as she lowered her leg back down. Samus decided to see if her new horseshoes had retained the function of her Jet Boots, so she began to trot, slowly building her speed up. Once she was satisfied she was moving fast enough, she leapt into the air, jumping much higher than she could as a human. Once she was in the air, she kicked her legs down, like she normally did to activate her Jet Boots. As she did so, she felt the thrust under her four hooves as the jets activated, lifting her even higher into the air. Samus landed with a grunt, and trotted forward a few steps to slow herself down.

“Huh,” said Samus, breathing heavily. “Guess I really do have Jet Horseshoes.”

Satisfied with her test, Samus slowly walked back over to the mirror, taking another look at herself. She examined her reflection again, then lifted her head up to meet her reflection’s eyes as she formed her opinion of the Zero Suit version of the Centaur Upgrade.

How does Samus feel about the upgrade?

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Samus didn't know where to begin. There were so many upgrades to choose from that she was having trouble deciding which one to try out. It didn't exactly help that most of the names were incredibly vague, making it difficult to tell which upgrades would actually be useful. She sighed, before deciding to just select one at random.

"The... Squid Upgrade?" she said to herself. It was apparently an upgrade for her Zero Suit. The name didn't provide much of a hint of what it would do. Would it let her breathe underwater? Would it help her swim better? Would it let her spray ink? Would she grow tentacles? She guessed there was really only one way to find out, and plugged the chip the computer had ejected into the upgrade slot on her hip.

The upgrade started to take effect, changing Samus' clothing. Her Zero Suit split apart at the waist, separating the top half and the bottom half, and the boots split off from the legs as well. The pants of the Zero Suit began to recede up her legs, stopping at about mid-thigh. They turned black, but kept a stripe of light blue down the side of each side.

The top part of the Zero Suit receded as well, slipping away from her hands and crawling up her arms. They stopped just below her shoulders, as the material on her neck sank down as well. Now looking for like a t-shirt, the top of the Zero Suit loosened considerably, and changed its texture to become a softer cloth rather than being shiny and elastic.

The heels of Samus' boots sunk down as the labric began to feel looser around her feet, while simultaneously becoming thicker. Laces stitched their way through the fabric, tying themselves in bows to hold the boots, which were now a pair of sneakers, on Samus' feet. She felt a weight on her back, and looking behind her, she found a large glass tank, with green casing at the top and bottom, which seemed to be filled with a strange blue liquid. It was hanging from her back by a pair of straps over her shoulders.

"Well, this is... odd." Samus had no idea what part of this outfit could be considered an upgrade. It seemed to have just turned her Zero Suit into a more casual attire, albeit with a tank of strange liquid on her back. It didn't even seem to have anything to do with squids, as the name of the upgrade would have suggested.

Samus turned back towards the computer, only to find that the upgrade wasn't quite done with her. As she reached for the keyboard, she suddenly felt somewhat cold. The cause, it seemed, was her skin, which had started to take on a slightly slicker texture, feeling almost slimy. "Huh?" She held up a hand to her face to get a better look at her skin. It was still about the same colour, but felt smoother and slipperier. Was this why it was called the Squid Upgrade?

"Oh?" As she held her hand up, Samus noticed that her fingernails seemed to be disappearing, and a similar feeling coming from her feet told her she was probably losing her toesnails as well. "What purpose does that serve?" she wondered aloud.

Now she felt her facial structure begin to change. She wasn't able to see the changes, but quickly noticed a mirror on the other side of the room, which she runed over to look at. By the time she was able to get a look at herself, her nose seemed to have gotten pointier, and curved upwards. She felt a bit of pain inside her mouth, and after opening up, she soon found the cause. Her top incisors had gotten sharper, and the two middle teeth on the bottom row had, somewhat painfully, merged together into a single tooth, that was equally as sharp as her incisors.

"So, sharper teeth as well, huh?" Samus mused. The next things to be affected were her ears, which started to grow much larger. "Oh my," Samus muttered as she watched them grow, each becoming a triangle about as big as her hand. "That's... interesting?" It didn't seem to have affected her hearing at all, so it was mainly just an aesthetic change, looking rather silly attatched to the sides of her head. Her eyes were next, the skin around them, and in the space between them, becoming thicker and rougher, turning black in the process. It made it look as if she were wearing a mask.

Next, her hair began to feel strange. It seemed to be clumping together into one large mass, turning as smooth and slick as her skin, save for her ponytail, which seemed to have split into two separate masses. Most of it turned the same light blue as her Zero Suit, and the liquid inside the tank, but the underside of her ponytail turned white instead, and what seemed to be a pair of suckers formed on thw two parts of her ponytail. "So, my ponytail is tentacles now?..." Samus' voice trailed off as she suddenly started to gain new feelings. She started to gain feeling in the tentacles her hair was now made of, as if they were extra body parts instead of just hair. It was almost like having two extra arms sticking out of her head.

"This... is woomy." Samus jumped as her throat emitted an unfamiliar sound, her organs felt like they were squishing around, rearranging to fit whatever species she now was. "Oooh, my stomach." Samus could tell she no longer seemed to be speaking anything that resembled English, but was still somehow able to understand what she was saying.

When her insides finally stopped sloshing around, Samus stood up straight and looked at herself in the mirror. She had to admit that she could kind of see the resemblance to a squid. "Still, what's the point of the upgrade?" she wondered aloud. She seemed to be some sort of human-like squid person dressed in civilian clothing, but it didn't seem like much of an upgrade. The only thing that seemed to have any sort of combat or exploration potential were the sharp teeth, and the mysterious tank on her back. Perhaps she'd be able to use it somehow? But as for how, she wasn't exactly sure.
